Package com.github.oeuvres.alix.lucene.search

Class FieldText

java.lang.Object
com.github.oeuvres.alix.lucene.search.FieldText
public class FieldText extends Object
An object recording stats for an indexed and tokenized lucene field TextField. Lexical stats needs heavy access to some counts that are not native in classical retrieving engine like lucene. For example, it could be expensive to get the list of most frequent or relevant terms from a set of documents found by a query. This object maintain such statistics in memory, for index considered like a “corpus” (a set texts considered as a whole).

  • Constructor Details

    • FieldText

      public FieldText(org.apache.lucene.index.DirectoryReader reader, String fieldName) throws IOException
      Build the dictionaries and stats. Each form indexed for the field will be identified by an int (formId). This id will be in freq order: the form with formId=1 is the most frequent for the index (formId=0 is the empty string).
      Parameters:
      reader - a lucene index reader.
      fieldName - name of a lucene text field.
      Throws:
      IOException - Lucene errors.

      Get a dictionary of terms, without statistics.
      Parameters:

      fieldName - a text field name.
      Returns:
      a bytes dictionary.

    • formEnum

      public FormEnum formEnum(org.apache.lucene.util.BitSet docFilter, TagFilter formFilter, Distrib distribution) throws IOException
      Count of occurrences by term for a subset of the index, defined as a BitSet. Returns an iterator sorted according to a scorer. If scorer is null, default is count of occurrences.
      Parameters:
      docFilter - a set of docId.
      formFilter - a set of formId.
      distribution - a scoring algorithm.
      Returns:
      an object to sort and loop forms.
      Throws:
      IOException - lucene errors.

    • formEnumByPart

      public FormEnum[] formEnumByPart(int parts, int[] classifier, TagFilter formFilter, Distrib scorer) throws IOException
      Get scored words for a partition of the full index. A part is a sequential int between [0, parts[. Parts are given as a vector of ints where classifier[docId]=part. If part < 0, the docId is not counted. Results are returned like an array of FormEnum, where FormEnum[part] is the scored list of term for the partition.
      Parameters:
      parts - count of parts.
      classifier - vector of ints where classifier[docId]=part.
      formFilter - filter words by tag.
      scorer - scorer.
      Returns:
      a set of dictionaries, one for each part.
      Throws:
      IOException - lucene errors.

    • formId

      public int formId(org.apache.lucene.util.BytesRef bytes, org.apache.lucene.util.BitSet docFilter) throws IOException
      Check if a form is present in a partition of the index. Returns its formId or -1 if not found, like BytesRefHash.find(BytesRef).
      Parameters:
      bytes - a word form as bytes.
      docFilter - set of docIds.
      Returns:
      formId if found, or -1 if not found in partition.
      Throws:
      IOException - Lucene errors.

      Parameters:
      forms - set of forms as CharSequence
      docFilter - set of DocId to include.
      Returns:
      sorted set of formId.

      IOException - lucene errors.

    • maxForm

      public int maxForm()

      Returns:
      max value id.

    • bytesSorted

      public org.apache.lucene.util.BytesRef[] bytesSorted(CharSequence[] forms)
      Normalize a list of forms to search in an IndexReader. Filter null and forms absent from the dictionary.
      Parameters:
      forms - collection of forms to test against dictionary.
      Returns:
      set of unique forms, sorted for efficient search with TermsEnum.seekExact(BytesRef).

    • bytesSorted

      public org.apache.lucene.util.BytesRef[] bytesSorted(int[] bytesIds)
      Normalize a list of formIds to search in an IndexReader. Filter forms absent from the dictionary.
      Parameters:
      bytesIds - collection of ids to test against dictionary.
      Returns:
      set of unique forms, sorted for efficient search with TermsEnum.seekExact(BytesRef).
